question: A muslim brother has to pay a huge amount of around Rs. 6.5 lakhs for her daughter's surgery (Cochlear Implantation Surgery), which he cannot afford by himself.
answer:
QUESTION

Assalaamu 'alaikum Mufti Sahib,

A muslim brother has to pay a huge amount of around Rs. 6.5 lakhs for her daughter's surgery (Cochlear Implantation Surgery), which he cannot afford by himself. I'd like to know whether the zakaat amount can be utilised to contribute for this noble cause, though the deserving person may not be eligible for zakaat for his normal living.

ANSWER


Share:

 

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

If the daughter has reached the age of maturity (puberty) and is herself eligible to receive Zakaah (i.e. she doesn't possess the amount of nisaab), then the money can be handed over to her ownership.1

 

Another option is for the father to take a loan for the 6.5 lakhs. If that loan of 6.5 lakhs takes his Zakaatable wealth below the value of Nisaab (i.e. because of the loan he no longer remains Sahib-Nisaab), he will then be eligible to receive 6.5 lakhs in Zakaat money to pay off his debt..2

 

May Allah grant her full and complete recovery. Ameen.

 

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum

 

Ml. Sohail Bengali
Correspondence Iftā Student, US.

Checked and Approved by:
Mufti Ebrahim Desai
Dārul Iftā

1           Bahishti Zewar, Maulana Ashraf Ali Thanwi (rahmatullahi alayhi), Part VII, pg. 115, Publisher: Saeed International

2              والغارم من لزمه دين أو له دين على الناس لا يقدر على أخذه وليس عنده نصاب
